docs.snippet: GALLAGHER--John Joseph, age 77, passed away peacefully on the Fourth of July, 2016. Born in New York City, he was an extraordinary and humorous storyteller, befitting his Irish heritage. Johnny served in the US Navy and continued his love of the s...
docs.lead_paragraph:
GALLAGHER--John Joseph,

age 77, passed away peacefully on the Fourth of July, 2016. Born in New York City, he was an extraordinary and humorous storyteller, befitting his Irish heritage. Johnny served in the US Navy and continued his love of the sea and boats working in the family business, Gallagher Bros. Sand and Gravel Corp. The second youngest of six siblings, he is survived by his sister Mary Alice Bissell and brother Gerard Bishop Gallagher. John was the husband of Berta Chiari Gallagher, who passed away in 2014, father to Theresa Harris and John Joseph Gallagher Jr. and grandfather to Jessica, Jake, Sean and Josie.

docs.snippet: REISMAN--Marvin. It is with great sorrow that we announce the passing of Marvin Reisman at the age of 87 at West Boca Medical Center on July 3, 2016. Marvin, loving husband of 61 years to Sally Reisman. Cherished father and father-in-law of Marci ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
REISMAN--Marvin.

It is with great sorrow that we announce the passing of Marvin Reisman at the age of 87 at West Boca Medical Center on July 3, 2016. Marvin, loving husband of 61 years to Sally Reisman. Cherished father and father-in-law of Marci and Michael Pomerantz and Allison and Peter Menkes. Devoted grandfather of Michaelan and Zhak Cohen, Sean and Sunny Menkes, Matthew, Jack, and Lianne Menkes. Marvin was formerly of Armonk, NY, and Manhattan. He was born in Brooklyn, NY on November 10, 1928 to Samuel and Anna Reisman. He graduated from Brooklyn College and Brooklyn Law School and became a founding partner of the law firm of Budin, Reisman, Kupserberg, and Bernstein. Marvin leaves a legacy of family love and respect, and the joy of living life to its fullest. A graveside service will be held on Sunday, July 10th, at 11am at Sharon Gardens Cemetery, 273 Lakeview Ave., Valhalla, NY 10595. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made in his memory to the Chiera Family Foundation, which helps send young cancer patients to summer camp and college. www.chierafamilyfoundatio n.org, or the Marvin Reisman Memorial Fund in Toronto at Baycrest.org/give or 416 785-2875.

docs.snippet: CHERBULIEZ--Theodore, formerly of Scarsdale, Dr. Cherbuliez died July 2 at home in South Freeport, ME. Born in Geneva, Switzerland, he came to the US for psychoanalytic training in 1959. Psychiatrist with Albert Einstein College of Medicine; Monte...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHERBULIEZ--Theodore, formerly of Scarsdale, Dr. Cherbuliez died July 2 at home in South Freeport, ME. Born in Geneva, Switzerland, he came to the US for psychoanalytic training in 1959. Psychiatrist with Albert Einstein College of Medicine; Montefiore Hospital; Cornell Medical School, Westchester, and in private practice for 53 years. In Geneva, consulted annually since 1974 with clinicians on innovative approaches to child welfare. Master Beekeeper, past President of American Apitherapy Society and Apimondia Apitherapy Commission. A consummate Swiss, his passions included mountain climbing, piloting, recorder playing, baking bread, and caring for generations of cats. Survived by his adored wife of 56 years Susan; sister Isaline (Geneva); daughters Ariane (Steven Orzack, Nora; Cambridge, MA); Nicole (Seth Clayter, Isabel, Lauren; Portland, ME); Lisa (John Terry, Eloise, Madeline, Charlotte; Needham, MA); Diana (Vinalhaven, ME); and Juliette (Matthias Rothe, Lucie and father Michael Opperman; Minneapolis, MN). Donations in his honor may be given to Doctors Without Borders, or The Southern Poverty Law Center.

headline.main: House Passes Measure to Stop Sale of Boeing Aircraft to Iran
headline.print_headline: House Passes Measure to Stop Sale of Boeing Aircraft to Iran

docs.snippet: A week before the one-year anniversary of the Iran nuclear deal, the Republican-led House approved measures aimed at blocking U.S. companies from selling commercial passenger aircraft to Tehran....

docs.snippet: At least two snipers opened fire on police officers in Dallas on Thursday night, killing four officers and injuring seven others during protests over two recent fatal police shootings of black men, police said....
docs.lead_paragraph: At least two snipers opened fire on police officers in Dallas on Thursday night, killing four officers and injuring seven others during protests over two recent fatal police shootings of black men, police said.

headline.main: State Department to Conduct Internal Probe of Clinton Email Case

docs.snippet: The U.S. State Department said on Thursday it will conduct an internal review of whether Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton and her aides mishandled classified information, after the Justice Department declined to bring criminal cha...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. State Department said on Thursday it will conduct an internal review of whether Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton and her aides mishandled classified information, after the Justice Department declined to bring criminal charges.

headline.main: Most Suicides by U.S. Veterans Are by Those Over Age 50: Study
headline.print_headline: Most Suicides by U.S. Veterans Are by Those Over Age 50: Study

docs.snippet: Well over half of U.S. military veterans who took their own lives in 2014 were aged 50 or older, the government reported on Thursday in a study indicating that combat trauma predating the recent wars in Iraq and Afghanistan still accounts for many...
docs.lead_paragraph: Well over half of U.S. military veterans who took their own lives in 2014 were aged 50 or older, the government reported on Thursday in a study indicating that combat trauma predating the recent wars in Iraq and Afghanistan still accounts for many veteran suicides.
